meeting: Log Index Proposal Discussion - Date Unknown

log_index_proposal.highlight: Simplified log index proposal: ordered event lists (blocks, txs, logs) tree-hashed by type then value
Index tables generated per block or merged from multiple blocks; never modified after creation
Single block tables added instantly to headers; larger tables added with delay for async processing
Tables hashed into simple chain; small tables (last ~80 blocks) required for initialization
Bigger tables (>64 blocks) generated with ZK proofs; not added to consensus headers

technical_details.highlight: 64-byte encoding per entry; SSZ list hashing proposed with big-endian numbers for sorting
Exclusion proofs: prove non-existence via two adjacent sorted entries (~1KB for 10M+ blocks)
Log pattern queries: prover searches least popular item first, proves matches via Merkle proofs
Full history proof ~40KB using exponentially sized tables; vastly more efficient than bloom filters

implementation_considerations.highlight: ZK-friendly hash function selection still needed; SHA-2 may not be optimal
Receipts must remain for chronological ordering; content-ordered tables supplement, not replace
Infra providers should duplicate data for efficient proofs; consensus-only nodes discard finalized tables

action_items.action: Determine optimal ZK-friendly hash function for index tables
Finalize parameters: table sizes in consensus (currently 64 blocks proposed)
